meanings.definition: In a shabby or unkempt manner.
meanings.sent1: She dressed scabbily for the party, wearing old torn jeans and a faded t-shirt.
meanings.sent2: The old house was painted scabbily, with peeling paint and broken shutters.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, his attempt at a fancy hairstyle ended up looking scabbily messy.
meanings.sent4: The once grand theater now stood scabbily in the deserted town, a shadow of its former glory.
meanings.sent5: The stray cat looked scabbily as it wandered the streets, its fur matted and dirty.

meanings.definition: In a miserly or stingy manner.
meanings.sent1: He tipped the waiter scabbily, leaving only a few coins on the table.
meanings.sent2: The rich man lived scabbily, refusing to spend money on anything beyond necessities.
meanings.sent3: She scabbily hoarded her candy, refusing to share even a single piece with her friends.
meanings.sent4: The landlord scabbily refused to fix the leaking roof, causing more damage to the building.
meanings.sent5: The old man counted his coins scabbily, reluctant to part with any of his savings.
